metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6417 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
net/ceph/auth_x.c in Ceph, as used in the Linux kernel before 3.16.3, doesnot properly consider the possibility of kmalloc failure, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a long unencrypted auth ticket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-lowlatency - 3.13.0-37.64

linux-image-extra-3.13.0-37-generic - 3.13.0-37.64

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-37.64').
